basicInfo.notes: AWS launched in 2006 with S3 (March) and EC2 (August). Subsidiary of Amazon.com. Headquarters in Seattle, WA. 143,000+ employees. Operates 38 regions with 125+ data centers. Powers services in 190 countries. Lightsail launched 2016 as simplified VPS alternative to EC2. Market leader in cloud computing.

pricing.moneyBackExclusions: Pay-as-you-go; No traditional refund; Free tier available for 12 months

securitySsl.sslProvider: AWS Certificate Manager (free SSL for AWS resources)

policiesOverages.resourceAbuseDefinition: Cryptocurrency mining; spam; DDoS; ToS violations
policiesOverages.hiddenFeesNotes: Free tier 12 months (750 hours Lightsail); Lightsail simple pricing vs complex EC2; Support costs extra ($29-$15,000+/mo); CloudFront CDN separate; Data transfer out charges; Complex billing can surprise users

contentRestrictions.contentNotes: Relatively permissive; must comply with local laws; reserves right to terminate for abuse

business.affiliateCommissionAmount: Varies by service; AWS Partner Network available

editorial.knownIssues: Extremely poor Trustpilot rating (1.3) due to billing complaints and support issues; Complex pricing can lead to unexpected bills; Support costs extra (free tier has no support); Not beginner-friendly; EC2 pricing confusing; Lightsail less flexible than competitors
editorial.bestFor: Enterprise deployments needing AWS ecosystem; Developers comfortable with cloud infrastructure; Businesses needing compliance certifications (HIPAA, PCI, FedRAMP); Global deployments with 38 regions; Those already invested in AWS ecosystem
editorial.avoidIf: Beginner wanting simple hosting; Need included support; Want managed WordPress; Budget-conscious without cloud expertise; Need predictable billing
editorial.competitorComparisonNotes: Market leader in cloud (31% market share); 38 regions most of any provider; Lightsail simpler than EC2 ($5/mo); G2 4.6 excellent but Trustpilot 1.3 reflects billing/support frustration; More certifications than any competitor; Support expensive vs included support at DigitalOcean/Vultr

comparisonData.uniqueSellingPoint: Market-leading cloud provider with 38 regions, most compliance certifications, and Lightsail for simplified VPS at $5/month
comparisonData.idealCustomerProfile: Enterprise or developer needing global cloud infrastructure with extensive compliance certifications and AWS ecosystem integration

faqContent.faqIsThisHostGood: AWS is the market leader in cloud computing with excellent performance and the most compliance certifications. G2 rating 4.6 reflects enterprise satisfaction, though Trustpilot 1.3 reflects billing confusion and support complaints from smaller users.
faqContent.faqWhoOwnsThisHost: Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Amazon.com Inc., launched in 2006. Headquartered in Seattle, WA with 143,000+ employees.
faqContent.faqHowMuchDoesItCost: AWS Lightsail starts at $5/month for 1GB RAM, 40GB SSD, and 2TB transfer. EC2 pricing is usage-based and complex. 12-month free tier includes 750 hours of Lightsail or t2.micro EC2.
faqContent.faqIsItBeginnerFriendly: No. AWS is designed for developers and enterprises. Lightsail is simpler but still requires technical knowledge. Complex pricing can lead to unexpected bills for beginners.
faqContent.faqDoesItIncludeEmail: No, AWS does not include email hosting. Amazon SES (Simple Email Service) is available for transactional email at additional cost.
faqContent.faqCanIHostWordPress: Yes, via Lightsail one-click WordPress or manual EC2 installation. Not managed WordPress - you handle updates and security.
faqContent.faqWhatsTheUptime: AWS guarantees 99.99% uptime for EC2 and 99.9% for Lightsail with SLA credits for downtime.
faqContent.faqCanICancelAnytime: Yes, pay-as-you-go billing with no long-term contracts. Lightsail has fixed monthly pricing. Delete resources to stop billing.
